name: 5-bromoindole
Reason: 5-bromoindole has a melting point influenced by its structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The indole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-system, estimated at around +20 °C. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to its small size and limited ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around -5 °C. The bromine atom raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C.
